ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned further about the Indonesian language and culture.
Indonesian language and culture!
I furthered my knowledge of Indonesian language and develop stronger speaking and grammar skills.
I learned how to talk with native speakers as well as how to properly articulate well thought sentences in Indonesian.
You learn a lot about culture in addition to vocabulary and sentence structuring to better speak Indonesian
I improved my conversation and writing skills in Indonesian. This course expanded my grammar and vocabulary knowledge, and helped further my understanding of Indonesian culture.
grammar
I developed a deep understanding of the Indonesian Language
A lot about basic Indonesian
Indonesian speaking and writing.
I learned a lot more about Indonesian culture in L2, and being able to converse better with friends from Indonesia.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: great class, so so fun to take
Weaknesses: lack of structure

The first half of the course felt very structured and I learned a lot. However, after spring break, we started doing zooms with Indonesian students so much, it felt like we never really had the opportunity to learn more of the language. While it is cool and beneficial to directly interact with the Indonesian language and culture, it felt like the zooms ended up hindering the class more than they helped because they were too often.
I think the chats on zoom were very good. I think we could do a little more direct vocab
Class was very enjoyable and the teachers were really supportive of students in the class. I think main weakness was not a ton of feedback on performance along the course of the semester

This course is very fun and interesting. I would have liked if we covered a bit more grammar and pronunciation. But overall, this course is part of an excellent introductory series that helps develop a deep interest in the subject.

the teachers create an extrordinary sense of community 
could be better organized however
This course is awesome! Pak is incredible
Classes are a lot of fun!
A little more focus/direction in the latter half of the semester, and more focus on vocab/grammar than before.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I loved to learn more about the Indonesian language and the professor made class extremely fun.
Yes if you want to learn a new language at Yale with low workload and fun and engaging teachers.
Absolutely
Absolutely, the course is so fun. And the teachers are so sweet and nice, you genuinely become pals with them.
Yes I would, I would recommend it because of how great the learning environment in the class is.
Yes. Fun class and if you put in some effort you can get a lot out of it

I would highly recommend this course and any others from the Indonesian department. The information is interesting and the course is structured to be both entertaining and educational. It is more than just a language class, you learn culture and history as well.
yes, great community
I would definitely recommend this course
Yes, great class for a language credit.
Yes, it's a great course, particularly if you enjoy linguistics and are interested in Indonesia.
